snippet: After militants invaded the Yarmouk Palestinian refugee camp near Damascus, the situation there had descended into “lower levels of inhumanity.”
abstract: Thousands of Palestinians have been trapped for week in Syria's Yarmouk refugee camp since it was invaded by Islamic State militants; United Nations Relief and Works Agency pleads for assistance in getting food and medicine to starving refugees.

byline.original: By SOMINI SENGUPTA and RICK GLADSTONE

lead_paragraph: After militants invaded the Yarmouk Palestinian refugee camp near Damascus, the situation there had descended into “lower levels of inhumanity.”

headline.main: Crisis in Palestinian Camp in Syria Has Worsened Since ISIS Invasion, U.N. Says
headline.print_headline: Refugees in Syria Starving After ISIS Siege, U.N. Says

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: United Nations Relief and Works Agency
